CrazyChess.logic

Class AI

  • java.lang.Object
    • CrazyChess.logic.AI

  • public class AI
extends java.lang.Object
    The class responsible for the Artificial Intelligence in our game. It uses the minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to decide on what moves to make while also taking powerups, stage hazards and rulechanges into account.

      • minimax

        public CrazyChess.logic.AI.BoardDetails minimax(CrazyChess.logic.AI.BoardDetails board,
                                                int max_depth,
                                                java.lang.String whoseAI)
        The main method for the minimax algorithm
        Parameters:
        board - the BoardDetails obeject for the board
        max_depth - how many turns into the future the algorithm will look
        whoseAI - color of the AI player
        Returns:
        A BoardDetails object, where the best move has been made

      • explorePaths

        public int explorePaths(CrazyChess.logic.AI.BoardDetails board,
                        int curr_depth,
                        int max_depth,
                        java.lang.String whoseAI,
                        java.lang.String whoseTurn,
                        int preMax,
                        int preMin)
        Method that explores the possible paths using recursion
        Parameters:
        board - the BoardDetails obeject for the board
        curr_depth - how deep the search is currently
        max_depth - max depth for the search
        whoseAI - color of the AI player
        whoseTurn - color of the current turn
        preMax - previous maximum value of the gamestate (used for pruning)
        preMin - previous minimum value of the gamestate (used for pruning)
        Returns:
        the value of the gamestate currently being explored

      • findBestOutcome

        public int findBestOutcome(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractPiece[][]> boards,
                           java.lang.String whoseTurn,
                           int preMax,
                           int preMin)
        Parameters:
        boards - ArrayList of gamestates to be evaluated
        whoseTurn - color the current turn
        preMax - previous maximum value of the gamestate (used for pruning)
        preMin - previous minimum value of the gamestate (used for pruning)
        Returns:
        the gamestate value of of the best outcome

      • valuePiece

        public int valuePiece(AbstractPiece piece,
                      java.lang.String whoseTurn)
        Piece values (positive for white, negative for black) pawn = 1 knight = 3 bishop = 3 rook = 5 queen = 9 king = 0 (don't factor king into this, theres no point if you have no king)
        Parameters:
        piece - piece to be evaluated
        whoseTurn - color of the current turn
        Returns:
        the value for the inputed piece
